programme.title: Mana trakā ģimene 17
programme.desc: Pavisam “parasto” Grifinu ģimeni no izdomātās Rodailendas pilsētiņas droši var raksturot kā neaudzinātu, izlutinātu un absolūti nekorektu. Pītera un Luisas Grifinu jaunākais bērns ir inteliģents, sadistisks mazulis, kurš pastāvīgi meklē savu māti un kaļ plānus par pasaules pārņemšanu. Dēlam Krisam ir tikpat zems intelekta līmenis kā viņa tēvam, meita Mega veltīgi cenšas sadraudzēties ar “foršajiem cilvēkiem”, taču vienmēr tiek atstumta. Tikmēr runājošais un martīni malkojošais ģimenes suns Braiens ir vienīgais, kam ir kaut kripatiņa saprāta.

programme.title: Crime in Post-War Germany
programme.sub-title: Robbery, murder, rape; after the war, West Germany is the scene of brutal crimes. We explore how strained life was in the West zones and how a nation struggled to find new values.
programme.desc: Horrific crimes were committed in Germany following the end of World War II; leading experts and criminal investigators take a look at some of the most notorious criminal cases of the post-war era.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: In decoding Adolf Hitlers dictatorship, the question of why the all-powerful Fuhrer needed a close and constantly available circle at his beck and call is one deserving of examination.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: We look at the conversations at the heart of German power; the deciphering of archive images allows us to understand the motivations of the Nazi regime in their conquest of Europe.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Ancient Superstructures
programme.sub-title: Chambord is the largest of the Loire castles; with 220,000 tons of stone needed for its construction, it is one of the most important building sites of the Renaissance.
programme.desc: We delve into the engineering mysteries behind the worlds most famous ancient structures by observing them from perspectives ranging from satellite imagery right down to macro and microscopic levels.

programme.title: The Lost World of Angkor Wat
programme.sub-title: Laser surveys lead the team to undiscovered jungle temples, ground-penetrating radar reveals how kings took new territory, and could a huge jungle pyramid expose the makings of a mysterious cult?
programme.desc: Archaeologists use scanning and excavations to uncover temple complexes in the ancient city of Angkor in Cambodia; who were the people that built the biggest religious monument in the world?

programme.title: The Lost World of Angkor Wat
programme.sub-title: The team uses drones to explore one of the worlds largest ancient water systems, and ancient weapons and traces of a colossal iron industry reveal the truth behind the power of the Khmer military.
programme.desc: Archaeologists use scanning and excavations to uncover temple complexes in the ancient city of Angkor in Cambodia; who were the people that built the biggest religious monument in the world?

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: One of the richest men on Earth, Aristotle Onassis left a string of broken hearts in his wake, but no romance would catapult him into the limelight like his marriage to Jacqueline Kennedy.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: The Grimaldi family has held their posts as sovereigns of Monaco with the utmost grace, but one thing they have missed time and again is good luck in the love department.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: What happened to Mary Magdalene after the resurrection of Jesus? We follow history enthusiasts in southern France on their quest to find the remains of the saint in a place no-one has searched before.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: Can a golden disk billions of miles away reveal if we are alone in the universe, and what are the secrets in the bizarre 600-year-old Voynich Manuscript that no-one can read?
programme.desc: Hidden away in museums, laboratories, and storage rooms around the world are the most remarkable objects on Earth; using new research and technology, we get under their skin like never before.

programme.title: Sisi: Assassination of an Empress
programme.desc: September 10th, 1898: Italian anarchist Luigi Lucheni stabs the Austrian Empress Elisabeth with a file. The murder of the Empress is the beginning of a political struggle against anarchism in Europe.

programme.title: The Lost World of Angkor Wat
programme.sub-title: Laser surveys lead the team to undiscovered jungle temples, ground-penetrating radar reveals how kings took new territory, and could a huge jungle pyramid expose the makings of a mysterious cult?
programme.desc: Archaeologists use scanning and excavations to uncover temple complexes in the ancient city of Angkor in Cambodia; who were the people that built the biggest religious monument in the world?

programme.title: The Lost World of Angkor Wat
programme.sub-title: The team uses drones to explore one of the worlds largest ancient water systems, and ancient weapons and traces of a colossal iron industry reveal the truth behind the power of the Khmer military.
programme.desc: Archaeologists use scanning and excavations to uncover temple complexes in the ancient city of Angkor in Cambodia; who were the people that built the biggest religious monument in the world?

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Operation Barbarossas endgame does not come to fruition; with the world distracted, Japan launch their attack on Pearl Harbor, forcing American isolationists to join the war in earnest.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: War in Europe ends with Soviet and American troops surrounding the German army; in the Pacific, it takes the devastating nuclear bombs of Hiroshima and Nagasaki to force the Japanese surrender.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: In June 1914, the first steps towards war were made when Archduke Franz Ferdinand, from the house of Habsburg, was assassinated by Slav nationalist Gavrilo Princip.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: During WWI, men had to endure combat and extreme conditions; civilians dealt with food shortages and raids. The insidiousness of ethnic cleansing raised its head, and a young Adolf Hitler took note.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Stalin rises as the leader of the Bolsheviks, and in Munich, the German Workers Party takes a new name: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter, or Nazi as it would come to be called.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Barnbow shell factory produced well over half a million tonnes of explosives in just four years - we show how the war factories of WWI paved the way for the modern world.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: The Spitfire, the Hurricane, the Lancaster and Wellington bombers - aircraft which arguably won the Battle of Britain - had one thing in common: they were powered by the Rolls-Royce Merlin engine.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: On the 7th of December, 1941, the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor; the attack brought America into WWII and changed how battles were fought as the first-ever assault by aircraft-carrier based fighters.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: When we think of Skoda, we think of cheap and efficient family cars; back in the 1930s, its factory was the cover for espionage, sabotage, and the liberation of Jews from all over Europe.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: War Factories
programme.sub-title: Ferdinand Porsche was one of the most influential engineers in Nazi Germany; by inventing the most powerful war machines, he created the blueprint for the muscle cars that would make his name.
programme.desc: No matter how many soldiers you have, how clever your generals or how daring your strategy, you will not win a war if you dont have enough bullets, planes, or food. WW2 was a war of the factories...

programme.title: No Asylum: The Untold Chapter of Anne Franks Story
programme.desc: Newly-discovered letters of Anne Franks father Otto and interviews with their family reveal his struggle to save their family for the first time.

programme.title: Crime in Post-War Germany
programme.sub-title: After the war, hunger and adversity shape daily life in East Germany; this episode shows how dangerous daily life was in Berlin after 1945 and why those who survived the war went to extreme measures.
programme.desc: Horrific crimes were committed in Germany following the end of World War II; leading experts and criminal investigators take a look at some of the most notorious criminal cases of the post-war era.

programme.title: The Secrets of Hieroglyphics
programme.desc: We meet a team of Egyptologists in Luxor; they are intrigued by a richly adorned tomb where they try to uncover the secrets of its priests, scribes, painters, engravers and builders.

programme.title: No Asylum: The Untold Chapter of Anne Franks Story
programme.desc: Newly-discovered letters of Anne Franks father Otto and interviews with their family reveal his struggle to save their family for the first time.

programme.desc: Horrific crimes were committed in Germany following the end of World War II; leading experts and criminal investigators take a look at some of the most notorious criminal cases of the post-war era.

programme.title: Crime in Post-War Germany
programme.sub-title: Robbery, murder, rape; after the war, West Germany is the scene of brutal crimes. We explore how strained life was in the West zones and how a nation struggled to find new values.
programme.desc: Horrific crimes were committed in Germany following the end of World War II; leading experts and criminal investigators take a look at some of the most notorious criminal cases of the post-war era.

programme.title: Unearthed: Ancient Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King study an 800-year-old partial skeleton; motives include robbery and a brawl, but can they identify the killer?
programme.desc: Homicide detective Rod Demery and scientist Professor Turi King use modern techniques to investigate historys most intriguing murders; they visit Italy, Scotland, Denmark and the US.

programme.title: Revolutions That Changed History
programme.sub-title: Celtic Queen Boudica led a fierce rebellion against Roman oppression after her tribes mistreatment; destroying major cities, she nearly defeated Rome but secured her legacy in a devastating final clash.
programme.desc: This series exposes the truth behind ancient revolutions and revolts, from action-packed bloody battlegrounds to the intimate exchanges between confidants that were powerful enough to turn tides.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Salem witch trials were a series of hearings and prosecutions of people accused of witchcraft in colonial Massachusetts in 1692 and 1693; the state eventually pardoned those who died.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Vatican City has its own laws, police, and - unbelievably - its own ATMs that print out in Latin. Its a secret world of libraries, holy relics and artwork that does not allow access outsiders.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: J. Paul Getty was renowned for his wealth and frugality as well as his lack of empathy and compassion for his family. He would marry four times and sire five sons, but he died old and alone.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: Can a 3,000-year-old solid gold hat really see into the future? How could a tiny metal cube have won the war for Hitler? How could an intricate and complex clock have solved a billion-pound problem?
programme.desc: Hidden away in museums, laboratories, and storage rooms around the world are the most remarkable objects on Earth; using new research and technology, we get under their skin like never before.

programme.title: Lost Treasure Tombs of the Ancient Maya
programme.sub-title: We visit Copán in Honduras and Palenque in Mexico to follow archaeologists as they discover how the Maya lived; in Tikal in Guatemala, experts explore the scale of Maya kingdoms.
programme.desc: We follow archaeologists as they search for clues to how the Maya lived; with exclusive access to excavations, this is an amazing opportunity to learn what happened to this fascinating civilisation.

programme.title: Lost Treasure Tombs of the Ancient Maya
programme.sub-title: We investigate grim evidence of human sacrifice at Copán in Honduras, and experts brave an erupting volcano in Guatemala to search for clues explaining why the Maya abandoned their cities.
programme.desc: We follow archaeologists as they search for clues to how the Maya lived; with exclusive access to excavations, this is an amazing opportunity to learn what happened to this fascinating civilisation.

programme.title: Sisi: Assassination of an Empress
programme.desc: September 10th, 1898: Italian anarchist Luigi Lucheni stabs the Austrian Empress Elisabeth with a file. The murder of the Empress is the beginning of a political struggle against anarchism in Europe.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: In decoding Adolf Hitlers dictatorship, the question of why the all-powerful Fuhrer needed a close and constantly available circle at his beck and call is one deserving of examination.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: We look at the conversations at the heart of German power; the deciphering of archive images allows us to understand the motivations of the Nazi regime in their conquest of Europe.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Cleopatras Secret Tomb
programme.sub-title: Cleopatra did not hesitate to eliminate her enemies... even if they were family members; archaeologists enter the only Ptolemaic mausoleum ever discovered to shed light on the queens family.
programme.desc: Archaeologists may finally be close to finding Cleopatras final resting place thanks to new discoveries; join us and unravel the mysteries of this legendary queen.

programme.title: Cleopatras Secret Tomb
programme.sub-title: After delving in the Battle of Actium, this final episode takes us to Alexandria, where Cleopatra and her lover ended their lives; will this investigation finally lead to the legendary queens tomb?
programme.desc: Archaeologists may finally be close to finding Cleopatras final resting place thanks to new discoveries; join us and unravel the mysteries of this legendary queen.

programme.title: Tombs of Egypt: Imhotep, The Pyramid Creator
programme.sub-title: Zahi Hawass is excavating an enclosure called Gisr El-Mudir where sarcophagi containing mysterious mummies and rich painted tombs are discovered; will these treasures lead them to Imhotep?
programme.desc: Archaeologist Zahi Hawass and his team embark on a thrilling quest to find the tomb of Imhotep, the greatest scholar of ancient times and architect of the Step Pyramid of Djoser.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Researchers discovered a concrete city buried outside The Hague decades after WWII; more than 400 bunkers and defensive structures formed a vast underground network built to defend the coastline.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis spent the war pillaging museums, emptying coffers, and stealing everything of value; with so much still missing, where did the Nazis hide their stolen hoards?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis had all but lost the war by March of 1945, but Hitler still sent throngs of soldiers to protect an isolated area of occupied Poland from oncoming forces. What was he trying to hide?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: This episode focuses on Guernsey, an island which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Maisy Battery was made up of three-and-a-half miles of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc that tell a new story of D-Day.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: The Secrets of Hieroglyphics
programme.desc: We meet a team of Egyptologists in Luxor; they are intrigued by a richly adorned tomb where they try to uncover the secrets of its priests, scribes, painters, engravers and builders.

programme.title: Auschwitz - One Day
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of a typical day in 1944 at the concentration camp of Auschwitz; it is based on a unique document which is kept in the Israeli memorial site of Yad Vashem.

programme.title: Top Ten Warfare
programme.sub-title: The greatest 20th-century commanders understood warfare at both strategic and tactical level; some instilled loyalty in their troops through fear and intimidation while others inspired confidence.
programme.desc: This is the story of warfare in the modern age; from the Spitfire to the stealth bombers of the second Iraq conflict, each episode features ten stories from the conflicts of the 20th and 21st century.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Spanish island of Villa Winter was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The Masters of the Reich
programme.sub-title: We look at the Nazi hegemony from 1941 to its decline in 1945; deciphered archives show us the greatest offensive of the 20th century in the East as well as the apocalypse of a ruined Germany.
programme.desc: This series sheds a new light on the Second World War by revealing what the masters of the Reich and their acolytes were really saying to each other while being filmed thinking no-one could hear them.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler: Decoding A Dictator
programme.sub-title: Was Adolf Hitler a master of war or a maker of war? His obsessive quest for territorial domination led to early triumphs, but his refusal to listen to his generals led to catastrophic failures.
programme.desc: This series explores six distinctive aspects of the life and rule of Adolf Hitler and questions how a 30-year-old uneducated nobody was able to leave a legacy of unprecedented evil.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are attempting to rehabilitate a mentally ill young bull in the hospitals male herd, Kat gets her hands dirty with elephant poo, and Paul helps the vets treat an infected abscess.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James treats a Boyds Forest dragon at the clinic, Dr Shane treats a carpet python called Red, and Dr Catherine sees an emergency case; sun conure parakeet Tequila is in a lot of pain.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: No animals are as resilient as those who live in the coldest climes. Well reveal the surprising adaptations earths cold weather creatures have evolved to survive.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its Sunday morning, but its no day of rest for Julian as he heads to the Taylors farm; at Skeldale, shih-tzu puppy Lester - who needs surgery on a hernia - has all the staff purring.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian meets two-year-old Zac and his hedgehog, who needs surgery on her foot, and Lorraine brings her dog Corbin - who has a lump thats causing him pain when he walks - to see Peter at Skeldale.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Julz discovers lions in Manzi territory and is relieved when he finds the dogs safe, a brave puku antelope foils a Kakuli pack hunt, and the Stork pack recovers after losing a pup.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are attempting to rehabilitate a mentally ill young bull in the hospitals male herd, Kat gets her hands dirty with elephant poo, and Paul helps the vets treat an infected abscess.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Living your life at night can present extreme challenges and opportunities. Animals like owls, hyenas with super senses and insects that glow have evolved to succeed in this world without light.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes over to see worried cow farmer Joe, Peter heads to Richards farm - where a sheeps life is in danger - and at the Huddersfield hospital, Brandy the German Shepherd is lame and in pain.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy heads to the Mekong River in Thailand in search of one of the worlds largest and most terrifying river fish, the giant freshwater stingray.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: Investigators in the Badlands of Wyoming unearth the bones of a Mosasaur, a terrifying marine predator from the dinosaur age.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Giants
programme.sub-title: Dan ONeill is on a mission to find, film and measure the planets biggest predatory sharks; he heads to the Neptune Islands, a place that is perfect for spotting giant great whites.
programme.desc: Explorer, biologist and conservationist Dan ONeill is on the trail of the largest living animals in the world; what does it take to become and survive as a giant past or present?

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: If we had to pick one iconic African animal, it would be the elephant. Its ancestors have dominated the world and the five continents through an exceptional evolution.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: Today, the grizzly bear is a star in Yellowstone National Park. But the history of the bear is rooted in that of a large family of mammals: the carnivores, which appeared 60 million years ago.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Raptors
programme.sub-title: An extraordinary look at the extreme ways in which birds of prey conquer the toughest habitats on Earth ny taking on deadly prey; raptors have solutions to many very extreme challenges.
programme.desc: Birds of prey are our planets greatest hunters; united by a hooked beak, a taste for flesh and razor-sharp talons, they have conquered the globe. This is the story of raptors unparalleled success...

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: Australia is a land cast adrift since the time of the dinosaurs; isolated for millions of years, evolution has transformed its animals into the most impressive gladiators on the planet.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Cold hearts beat with a raging hot fury in a frozen world of snow, icy waters and extreme wind chill; from snow leopards to polar bears, these fighters battle it out with each other.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: The caracal always lives where the land and vegetation are the same colour; it is stealthy and silent, a perfect master of camouflage and also a specialist in deserts and savannahs.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Brown Hyenas
programme.desc: Follow along on a journey as we explore the mysteries of the Makgadikgadi pans through the eyes of a brown hyena mother and her clan as they navigate merciless temperatures.

programme.title: Massive Africa
programme.sub-title: 33,000 acres of land makes up the world-renowned MalaMala game reserve; this fascinating region is a hotbed for wildlife activity with some of the greatest game viewing opportunities in Africa.
programme.desc: An action-packed adventure through Africas last untamed majestic wildernesses; gain new perspective on the continents wonderlands, iconic natural marvels, and awe-inspiring wildlife spectacles.

programme.title: A Cheetahs Pride
programme.sub-title: Chilli, Inara and their nine cubs meet and a standoff ensues; the mothers eventually part, but Chillis cubs Siya and Kolisi mistakenly follow Inara.
programme.desc: Two cheetah mothers meet by chance; their cubs get mixed up and lead to one mother adopting the others cubs as her own. Stranger still is that they stay together instead of going their separate ways.

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We discover how some animals communicate when they need to work as a team; using a variety of techniques including sound, touch and visual displays, animals can come together and work as a group.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Being thin, having black spots on whitish hair, hyperventilating and licking regularly to evaporate saliva are the cheetahs most efficient tricks for tolerating its fiery environment.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Most species that live in extreme places are delaying their life cycles of reproduction and breeding; wild dogs are advancing their biology by several weeks to avoid the dangers of heat to their pups.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: The language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most striking and diverse behaviours of the animal world: dances, challenges, fights, pulses, and battles to mate with females.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Amanda races to save an elephant calf tangled in a poachers wire snare; Alma tries to get the newest - and cutest - arrival, a baby baboon nicknamed Doodle Bob, to bond with a foster baboon mother.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.sub-title: Dr James must save a very special bird, Dr Hamish treats very cute Australian mammal Shug, and Dr Lucinda investigates why adopted pet cockatiel Snowy is laying an excessive number of eggs.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.desc: In India, we follow the daily struggles of the living characters Rudyard Kipling described in The Jungle Book as all obey the unwritten law of the jungle and strive to raise a new generation.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: Our planet has had a difficult and violent past; the potential for life all began when Earth collided with another protoplanet the size of Mars shortly after the formation of our solar system.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: Throughout its history, Earth has continuously fluctuated between greenhouse and icehouse; however, this particular icehouse phase is the most extreme period of cold our planet has ever witnessed.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: The Worlds Most Beautiful Landscapes
programme.sub-title: Discover the Mekong river in southeast Asia, following its course through six countries via astonishing waterfalls, the worlds most amazing lake, and one of the worlds most diverse rainforests.
programme.desc: Travel through the worlds most beautiful landscapes; from wide views to the tiniest close-up, witness spectacular footage and discover the glories of rivers, jungles, and mountains from every angle.

programme.title: Raptors
programme.sub-title: An extraordinary look at the extreme ways in which birds of prey conquer the toughest habitats on Earth ny taking on deadly prey; raptors have solutions to many very extreme challenges.
programme.desc: Birds of prey are our planets greatest hunters; united by a hooked beak, a taste for flesh and razor-sharp talons, they have conquered the globe. This is the story of raptors unparalleled success...

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: Australia is a land cast adrift since the time of the dinosaurs; isolated for millions of years, evolution has transformed its animals into the most impressive gladiators on the planet.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Cold hearts beat with a raging hot fury in a frozen world of snow, icy waters and extreme wind chill; from snow leopards to polar bears, these fighters battle it out with each other.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: The Great Barrier Reef: A Living Treasure
programme.sub-title: The Great Barrier Reef is a living, breathing organism supporting the richest and most complex ecosystem on the planet; we explore Koala Island and take a closer look at lionfish, crocodiles and more.
programme.desc: This four-part series explores different corners and depths of the reef, looking at wildlife in their natural habitat and covering the full spectrum of this sprawling ecosystem.

programme.title: The Great Barrier Reef: A Living Treasure
programme.sub-title: The Great Barrier Reef is the only place in the world where ancient rainforest meets a tropical reef, with the coastal fringe supporting a variety of unique wildlife.
programme.desc: This four-part series explores different corners and depths of the reef, looking at wildlife in their natural habitat and covering the full spectrum of this sprawling ecosystem.

programme.title: The Great Barrier Reef: A Living Treasure
programme.sub-title: Stretching 2,300 kilometres down the northeast coast of Queensland, the Great Barrier Reef is home to over 900 islands, each with their own unique biology and fauna.
programme.desc: This four-part series explores different corners and depths of the reef, looking at wildlife in their natural habitat and covering the full spectrum of this sprawling ecosystem.

programme.title: The Great Barrier Reef: A Living Treasure
programme.sub-title: The Great Barrier Reef lies in the Coral Sea; here wildlife flourishes in the pristine tropical seas that are home to the worlds richest marine ecosystem.
programme.desc: This four-part series explores different corners and depths of the reef, looking at wildlife in their natural habitat and covering the full spectrum of this sprawling ecosystem.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years, and a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr Jamess dad brings in Lucy, a wounded mangrove monitor lizard, Dr Kiara treats a wild echidna, and Dr Hamish must uncover the cause of Bernoulli the Alexandrine parrots behaviour changes.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: To reach adulthood, animals must constantly overcome many obstacles; from mantids to scimitar-horned oryx, some animals have adapted in surprising ways to ensure they make it to old age unscathed.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes over to see worried cow farmer Joe, Peter heads to Richards farm - where a sheeps life is in danger - and at the Huddersfield hospital, Brandy the German Shepherd is lame and in pain.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.
